CatDescriptText: Warner Macklin, hotel worker, 240 Dinwiddle Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 21, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you think that the steel strike will be resumed after the 80-day 'cooling-off' period imposed by the Supreme Court under the injection of the Taft-Hartley Act?" Answer reads: "I hope that there will be a settlement, but if there isn't, the steelworkers probably will resume the strike, and rightly so."
TitMainTitle: Warner Macklin wearing varsity jacket inscribed "Piggy," standing in front of painted brick wall
